categories.title: 2b. JSON Editing Rules (IMPORTANT!)
categories.purpose: Critical syntax rules to avoid breaking the website

commands.description: ‚úÖ CORRECT: Use double quotes, comma after each item
‚úÖ CORRECT: NO comma on the LAST item in a list
‚ùå WRONG: Never use single quotes in JSON
‚úÖ CORRECT: true/false (no quotes for booleans)
‚ùå WRONG: Don't put quotes around true/false
üí° TIP: Dreamweaver shows red errors if JSON syntax is wrong

categories.title: 2c. JSON File Format Guide
categories.purpose: Understanding the structure and format of JSON files for website content

commands.description: JSON files contain data in key-value pairs enclosed in curly braces { }
Text values must be in double quotes
Boolean values (true/false) have no quotes
Numbers can be in quotes for consistency
Arrays (lists) use square brackets [ ]
Put commas after each item, EXCEPT the last item in a list
Objects in arrays - note NO comma after the last object
